title: Understanding Reliability
text: Reliability in research refers to the consistency of a measure. A study is considered reliable if it produces similar results under consistent conditions.

hintAnswer: To ensure consistent results across different trials and conditions
title: Importance of Reliability
text: Why is it important for research studies to demonstrate reliability?
choices: To ensure consistent results across different trials and conditions
To increase the number of participants in the study
To allow researchers to use more complex statistical methods
To make the study more appealing to funding agencies
